title: Unit 7 Checkpoint: Volume & Similarity Applications
description: Summative checkpoint assessing volume of cylinders, cones, and spheres, volume scaling, and real-world volume applications.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: V = πr²h. r is radius (half of diameter). Connect to prism: area of base × height.
V = (1/3)πr²h — one-third of the cylinder with same base and height. 3 cones fill 1 cylinder.
V = (4/3)πr³. Only needs radius. Common error: using diameter instead of radius.
Scale factor k: new volume = k³ × old volume. Double all dimensions → 2³ = 8× volume. Triple → 27× volume.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the volume of a cylinder with radius 5 cm and height 10 cm. Give your answer in terms of π.
A cylindrical water tank has diameter 8 feet and height 12 feet. How many cubic feet of water can it hold? Use π ≈ 3.14.
Find the volume of a cone with radius 3 cm and height 8 cm. Give your answer in terms of π.
A cone and a cylinder have the same radius (6 cm) and the same height (10 cm). How many times does the cone's volume fit into the cylinder?
assessmentProblems.answer: V_cyl = π(36)(10) = 360π. V_cone = (1/3)(360π) = 120π. The cone fits exactly 3 times. (The cone is always 1/3 of the cylinder with same base and height.)

assessmentProblems.question: Find the volume of a sphere with radius 6 cm. Give your answer in terms of π.
A basketball has a diameter of 24 cm. Find its volume. Use π ≈ 3.14.
A cylinder has radius 4 cm and height 9 cm. If all dimensions are doubled, what is the new volume? How does it compare to the original?
assessmentProblems.answer: Original: V = π(16)(9) = 144π. Doubled: r=8, h=18. V = π(64)(18) = 1152π. Ratio: 1152π / 144π = 8. The volume is 8 times larger (2³ = 8).

assessmentProblems.question: A sphere has volume 36π cm³. If the radius is tripled, what is the new volume?
An ice cream cone (cone shape) has radius 3 cm and height 12 cm. A hemispherical scoop of ice cream with radius 3 cm sits on top. What is the total volume? Express in terms of π.
ANALYSIS: Explain in your own words why doubling the radius of a sphere makes the volume 8 times larger, not 2 times larger.
assessmentProblems.answer: The volume formula uses r³ (radius cubed). When you double r, you're cubing 2r: (2r)³ = 8r³. The exponent 3 means the factor of 2 gets multiplied three times: 2 × 2 × 2 = 8. Volume is a three-dimensional measurement, so scaling one dimension by k scales the volume by k³.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL: Find the distance between (−2, 3) and (4, −5).

answerKeys.g8u7-10: V uses r³, so doubling r gives 2³=8× volume.
